metadata.titel_preek: index_split_010: The Third Word from the Cross

locutie.beschrijving: The preacher explains the scene at the cross, provides two personal anecdotes (Luba and the Catholic rectory), and offers a Johannine exegesis of 'Woman' and 'Behold thy son'.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Distinguishes between the literal/historical and the symbolic/Johannine meaning of the text.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting facts about the text and the nature of the church, with a shift to expressive prayer at the conclusion.
voorbeelden: In John's Gospel, she plays a symbolic role.
The saying is not about being nice to your mother.
By rewriting the covenant in his own blood, Jesus has done something completely new.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: The hearer should understand the church as a spiritual family transcending blood ties.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Moderate; mentioned as the agent of the new community, but not explicitly invoked as the power of the sermon itself until the end.

voorbeelden: Saint John tells us that Jesus...
There is something more at stake here.
The Christian community has a quality...
May we who belong to Christ be newly committed...
I will carry that memory around with me...
My heart aches for the pain of the Catholic Church.
Jesus has done something completely new [implied promise of new life].
commissieven.kwaliteit: Weak. The promises are described as historical facts rather than offered as current guarantees to the listener.

voorbeelden: May God deliver the whole Church...
May his blessed Holy Spirit come afresh...
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher shifts to optative (wishing) rather than declarative (pronouncing) authority.

indicatoren: Extensive storytelling (Luba, Rectory) that illustrates but does not 'do'.
Third-person description of what Jesus did 'then'.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a spectator of a beautiful idea rather than a participant in a new reality.

missende_elementen: Direct promise ('Christ creates this family for YOU now')

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: The 'Toezegging' is missing; it is replaced by 'explanation' of a past toezegging.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Mostly quoting the Bible ('you are all one') or hypothetical ('you have been to Ephesus').

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Jesus, Mary, the Church, and the world.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Narrating the cross and personal stories.

voorbeelden: Jesus is calling people... May we be newly committed.
foutief_patroon.probleem: The 'event' of the new community is talked about as a concept, then the hearer is asked to be committed to it, without the sermon itself performing the 'calling'.

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: The Christian community... comes into being... May we be newly committed.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is an excellent lecture on the Johannine theology of the cross, but it remains 'about' the text rather than becoming the 'Word of God' to the listener.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: It does not seem to fit the theology of John's Gospel at all...

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The saying is not about being nice to your mother.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Defines what it is NOT, but doesn't DO what it IS.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon informs the mind but does not 'happen' to the hearer. The hearer is not 'brought into' the family by the word, but told that such a family exists.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: Lacks the 'I-Thou' address of the Mandatory.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: No. The preacher is the narrator of God's past actions.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Weakly. The preacher acts as an expert witness rather than an ambassador.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Partially. The closing prayer leaves the effect to the Spirit.
tekstueel_bewijs: May his blessed Holy Spirit come afresh...

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: No. The sermon is a reflection on the means of grace (the Cross), not the means itself.
tekstueel_bewijs: What we do see happening here...

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many 3rd person singular 'is' and 'was' verbs. Needs 2nd person plural 'receive' and 'are'.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Jesus is calling people into a new relationship.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, from this cross, Jesus calls YOU into this family.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a general truth to a present encounter.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is buried in historical description.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use the 'Toezegging' (Promise) to bind the hearer to the cross.
voorbeeldzinnen: In Christ's blood, I declare that you are no longer a stranger, but a member of God's household.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: The 'we' is too general; the 'you' is absent.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Address the congregation directly as the 'new family'.
voorbeeldzinnen: Look at the person next to you; Christ gives them to you as a brother.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The imperative ('be committed') lacks the fuel of a present indicative ('you are made new').
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Declare the new reality before asking for commitment.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The exegesis is brilliant and the stories are moving, but the sermon needs to move from 'talking about' the cross to 'speaking from' the cross.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' in the stories; SAT focuses on the lack of a 'Declarative' act from God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetorically, the stories are effective 'pathos'. In SAT, they are 'locutionary surplus' that delays the 'illocutionary' strike.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that despite the orthodox content, the sermon functions as a lecture because it lacks Commissive and Declarative force.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The saying is not about being nice to your mother.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Good for clarity, bad for event-character.

appendices.notities: The preacher is highly skilled in locution, but hesitant in illocutionary authority.
